meanings.definition: A large bomb used to demolish extensive areas or buildings.
meanings.sent1: The military used blockbusters to destroy enemy fortifications.
meanings.sent2: The demolition team set off a blockbuster to bring down the old building.
meanings.sent3: The blockbuster exploded with a loud bang, sending debris flying everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The blockbuster bomb tore through the walls like a wrecking ball.
meanings.sent5: The force of the blockbuster blast shook the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: A very successful and profitable movie, book, or other product.
meanings.sent1: The new superhero movie was a blockbuster at the box office.
meanings.sent2: The author's latest novel became a blockbuster bestseller.
meanings.sent3: Everyone wanted to see the blockbuster film, creating long lines at the theater.
meanings.sent4: The blockbuster movie captivated audiences with its thrilling plot.
meanings.sent5: The blockbuster product flew off the shelves as soon as it was released.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very successful or popular.
meanings.sent1: The young singer became a music industry blockbuster overnight.
meanings.sent2: The tech company's latest gadget was a commercial blockbuster.
meanings.sent3: The adorable puppy was a real blockbuster at the pet adoption event.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion line became a blockbuster hit among teenagers.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's new dish was a culinary blockbuster, drawing in crowds of food enthusiasts.
